editorialSummary.text: Hindu temple featuring ornate towers & outdoor statues of deities, plus colourful lights at night.

text.text:
Kanak Durgamma temple is located in the city of ballary, Karnataka. Goddess Durgamma is the main god in this temple. During auspicious days the devotees crowd is unimaginable. Temple is quite old and the architecture is like a wow. Few statues are created in metal and could be found outside the temple. A pond is there inside the temple. Recently the renovation work got completed and all the ancient rocks are covered with tiles and marbles.
Must visit and get the devotional feel.

editorialSummary.text: Hilltop remains of a stone military fortress, founded in the 16th century and renovated in the 18th.

text.text: First we felt it waste of time and money but after reached top approx 400 steps the view was amazing and beautiful… at that movement no one has there… the movement was captured… there best time to visit this place is morning and expect summer…. More history was hidden in this place…. There is no architecture in this place but should learn how to construct…this is one of the best monument… should visit and save it…. Entry fee Rs25 and just 2km from Ballary station….easy transportation….

text.text: Bellary Fort, a historic marvel nestled in Karnataka, boasts a rich tapestry of tales dating back to the 16th century. Originally built by the Vijayanagara Empire, it witnessed successive rulers, including Hyder Ali and the British. The fort's strategic location atop Ballari Gudda hill offers panoramic views of the city below. Though weathered by time, its towering walls and bastions stand as enduring testaments to its storied past, inviting visitors to explore centuries of history.

originalText.text: Bellary Fort, a historic marvel nestled in Karnataka, boasts a rich tapestry of tales dating back to the 16th century. Originally built by the Vijayanagara Empire, it witnessed successive rulers, including Hyder Ali and the British. The fort's strategic location atop Ballari Gudda hill offers panoramic views of the city below. Though weathered by time, its towering walls and bastions stand as enduring testaments to its storied past, inviting visitors to explore centuries of history.

text.text:
Bellary Fort is a historical site with more than 3000 years of history. It was constructed at the time of Vijayanagar Empire by Hanumappa Nayaka. The fort was captured by Hyder Ali back in 1769 and was then remodelled by a French engineer. The fort is situated at the Ballari Gudda hilltop.

One of the major reasons for its attraction is the fort being built on a monolithic rock. The fort is divided into Upper and Lower fort. It is a polygonal fort with only one entrance. There is a citadel of 1976 ft. and includes structures like pools, cisterns, temple and cells. The tunnel is believed to have link to the cities of Sriragapatna and Mysore. The top can be reached with a single rocky way.

originalText.text:

One of the major reasons for its attraction is the fort being built on a monolithic rock. The fort is divided into Upper and Lower fort. It is a polygonal fort with only one entrance. There is a citadel of 1976 ft. and includes structures like pools, cisterns, temple and cells. The tunnel is believed to have link to the cities of Sriragapatna and Mysore. The top can be reached with a single rocky way.

text.text:
Awesome place to visit.. Better to visit in the morning or evening.

editorialSummary.text: Hindu temple with an ornate facade constructed between the 8th & 10 centuries.

text.text:
It is Sri Kumara Swamy temple located in Ballari City, it is not the Kumara Swamy temple of Sandur, most people have confused & uploaded Sandur Kumara Swamy temple photos in this location, please don't mislead people, delete your photos & reviews here, upload the same in Kumara Swamy temple which is located in Karthikeshwara, Sandur

About the temple, it is well maintained, there is Sri Kumara Swamy, Shiva, Ganesha, Anjaneya, Dakshina Murthi, Adhi Shankaracharya, Gayathri, Saraswathi, Navagrahas, Nagas (all deities packed at one place), Mango tree, Peepal tree & many more trees

Lake with walk path

text.text:
Ayyappa Swamy Temple
Peaceful 🙏🙏 place very clean maintenance

originalText.text:
Ayyappa Swamy Temple
Peaceful 🙏🙏 place very clean maintenance

text.text:
One of the biggest Ayyappa Swamy Temples in Bellary. It’s the largest temple exclusively for Ayyappa Swamy. It’s a gold idol which is astonishingly beautiful. Priests and manager are very friendly. They organize every pooja very well. Every Wednesday is an auspicious day for Ayyappa. This temple is the perfect replica for the great Sabarimala Temple, Kerala.
Swamiye Saranam Ayyappa.

originalText.text:
